original: Aronson, Aron Meyer, praktiserande läkare, Halmstad, f. 1/2/05 i Gbg av handl. J. A. o. Bertha Katzeff. G. 33 m. sjuksköt: an Karin Mellblom. Barn: Göran f. 34, Stefan 37, Helen 43. — Stud:ex. i Gbg 24, med. kand. i Upps. 27 o. med. Hc. där 31. Ett flert. kort. vik. v. sanat., sjukh., hosp. m. m. 31-32, e. läk. v. radiolog. khn. i Lund 32, tf. andre und:läk. v. Sundsvalls sanat. 32-33, ord. dito 33-34, där- und. tf. förste und :läk. fem mån., tf. und:läk. v. Bollnäs las. 34, assist :läk. v. Sahlgr. sjukh. kir. avd. s. å., assist :läk. o. tf. und:läk. v. dess röntgen-avd. 34-35, tf. förste und :läk. v. Karlshamns las. 35-36, ord. dito 36-37, förste und:läk. v. kir. avd. där 37-38, e. läk. o. und:läk. v. med. avd. där 38-41, prakt. läk. i Ha:lm;stad sed. 41. Bat:-läk. v. Fik 38, v. Hall. reg. 41-45, i Fik res. 45.
translated: Aron Meyer Aronson was a practicing physician in Halmstad. He was born on February 1, 1905 in Gothenburg to J.A. and Bertha Katzeff, who were merchants. He married nurse Karin Mellblom in 1933 and they had three children: Göran, born in 1934, Stefan in 1937, and Helen in 1943. Aronson graduated from high school in Gothenburg in 1924, obtained a Bachelor's degree in Medicine from Uppsala University in 1927, and a Doctor of Medicine degree from the same school in 1931. He held various short-term positions at hospitals and clinics from 1931 to 1932, became a radiologist at a hospital in Lund in 1932, temporarily served as a second assistant physician at Sundsvalls Hospital from 1932-1934, became a first assistant physician there for 5 months, temporarily served as an assistant physician at Bollnäs Hospital in 1934, became an assisting physician and temporary second assistant physician at Sahlgrenska Surgery Department in the same year, was a temporary first assistant physician at Karlshamn Hospital from 1935-1936, became an ordinary first assistant physician there from 1936-1937, became a first assistant physician in the surgical department from 1937-1938, and an attending physician and temporary second assistant physician in the medical department from 1938-1941 before becoming a practicing physician in Halmstad from 1941. He also served as a battalion physician in Fik in 1938 and with the Halland Regiment from 1941-1945, and was a reserve physician in Fik in 1945.
